title: `TreeExplainer.save` throws `AttributeError: 'TreeEnsemble' object has no attribute 'save'`

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behaviour

body:
Sorry if I'm missing something, but `TreeExplainer.save` doesn't seem to work:

```python
import shap
import xgboost as xgb
from sklearn.datasets import load_iris

print(xgb.__version__)
print(shap.__version__)

dtrain = xgb.DMatrix(*load_iris(return_X_y=True))
model = xgb.train({}, dtrain)
exp = shap.TreeExplainer(model)

with open("TreeExplainer", "wb") as out_file:
    exp.save(out_file)
```

When I run this code, I get:

```python
1.4.2
0.39.0
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "a.py", line 13, in <module>
    exp.save(out_file)
  File "/Users/foo/.pyenv/versions/miniconda3-4.7.12/envs/bar/lib/python3.7/site-packages/shap/explainers/_explainer.py", line 398, in save
    s.save("model", self.model, model_saver)
  File "/Users/foo/.pyenv/versions/miniconda3-4.7.12/envs/bar/lib/python3.7/site-packages/shap/_serializable.py", line 87, in save
    if len(inspect.getfullargspec(value.save)[0]) == 3: # backward compat for MLflow, can remove 4/1/2021
AttributeError: 'TreeEnsemble' object has no attribute 'save'
```
